English.page_title: Full Measurements + Advanced Road Bike Fit
English.expander_help_instructions:
- Below fields follow the original report orderâ€”please have a friend help measure each item.
- If youâ€™re unsure how to measure, expand to see illustrated instructions.
English.#help_instructions_1_content: Stand legs together against a wall, place a book at crotch, measure from book top to heel (cm).
English.#help_instructions_2_content: Stand against a wall, measure from C7 to top of pelvis (iliac crest) vertically (cm).
English.#help_instructions_3_content: Bend elbow ~90Â°, measure from elbow center to distal wrist (cm).
English.#help_instructions_4_content: Measure from acromion (shoulder) to elbow center in a straight line (cm).
English.#help_instructions_5_content: Measure from greater trochanter (hip) to knee center in a straight line (cm).
English.#help_instructions_6_content: Measure from knee center to highest point of medial malleolus (ankle) (cm).
English.#help_instructions_7_content: Stand naturally, have friend measure from floor to sternal notch (cm).
English.#help_instructions_8: How to measure Total Body Height?
English.#help_instructions_8_content: Stand barefoot against a wall, measure from floor to top of head (cm).
English.#help_instructions_9_content: Stand relaxed, have friend measure between acromion points (cm).
English.#help_instructions_10: How to measure Sit Bone Width?
English.#help_instructions_10_content: Sit on a hard bench, have friend mark the two sit bone points, measure horizontal distance (cm).
English.stack_result: â–¶ Recommended Stackï¼š{suggested_adv} mm ï¼ Î” = {delta_adv} mm â†’ add spacer {spacer_adv} cm.
English.reach_result: â–¶ Recommended Reachï¼š{suggested_adv} mm ï¼ Î” = {delta_adv} mm â†’ adjust stem by Â±{delta_adv} mm.
English.shoulder_result: â–¶ Recommended handlebar widthï¼š{value} cm Â± 2 cm (Common: 38/40/42/44 cm)
English.crank_result: â–¶ Crank lengthï¼š{value_adv} mm (by thigh/leg segments).
English.health_tip1: - If your hip or lower back is stiff, add +0.5 cm to recommended Stack to reduce stress.
English.health_tip2: - If limited neck mobility, reduce Reach by 10 mm or raise stem by 5 mm.
English.health_tip3: - If sternal notch height minus sit bone height is too large, keep handlebar drop under 60 cm to avoid low back strain.
English.health_tip4: - If you have injury history or pelvic tilt, consult a physical therapist before major adjustments.
